metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11815 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in rds_tcp_kill_sock in net/rds/tcp.c in the Linuxkernel before 5.0.8. There is a race condition leading to a use-after-free,related to net namespace cleanup.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11815` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-55-generic - 4.15.0-55.60
linux-image-4.15.0-55-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-55.60
linux-image-4.15.0-55-lowlatency - 4.15.0-55.60
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-55-generic - 4.15.0-55.60
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-55-lowlatency - 4.15.0-55.60
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1041-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1041.44
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1058-snapdragon - 4.15.0-1058.64
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1047-aws - 4.15.0-1047.49
No subscription required

linux-image-5.0.0-23-generic - 5.0.0-23.24~18.04.1
linux-image-5.0.0-23-generic-lpae - 5.0.0-23.24~18.04.1
linux-image-5.0.0-23-lowlatency - 5.0.0-23.24~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.0.0-23-generic - 5.0.0-23.24~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.0.0-23-lowlatency - 5.0.0-23.24~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1037-gke - 4.15.0-1037.39
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.0.0-1011-gke - 5.0.0-1011.11~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.18.0-1025-azure - 4.18.0-1025.27~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1037-gcp - 4.15.0-1037.39
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1039-kvm - 4.15.0-1039.39
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1050-oem - 4.15.0-1050.57
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1018-oracle - 4.15.0-1018.20
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-55.60').
linux-raspi2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1041.44').
linux-snapdragon package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1058.64').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49').
linux-hwe package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-23.24~18.04.1').
linux-gke-4.15 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1037.39').
linux-gke-5.0 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-1011.11~18.04.1').
linux-azure package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.18.0-1025.27~18.04.1').
linux-gcp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1037.39').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1039.39').
linux-oem package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1050.57').
linux-oracle package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1018.20').
